perturbation.original_text: (b) marketing and selling, or otherwise designating the purchasers of, the furniture, furnishings, trade fixtures, machinery, equipment, office supplies, Supplies (as defined below), conveyor systems, racking, rolling stock, and other tangible personal property (collectively, "FF&E") owned by Merchant, wherever located ("Owned FF&E");
perturbation.changed_text: (b) marketing and selling, or otherwise designating the purchasers of, the furniture, furnishings, trade fixtures, machinery, equipment, office supplies, Supplies (as defined below), conveyor systems, racking, rolling stock, and other tangible personal property (collectively, "Fixtures and Fittings") owned by Merchant, wherever located ("Owned FF&E");
perturbation.explanation: The term "FF&E" (Furniture, Fixtures, & Equipment) is a well-defined legal and accounting term. Replacing it with "Fixtures and Fittings" introduces ambiguity. 'Fixtures and Fittings' is not consistently defined, and can lead to disputes over what is included, conflicting with standard business practice. This may cause confusion on the items included in the sale.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Article 9; Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)

perturbation.original_text: Subject to and only upon entry of the Approval Order, Agent shall be responsible for the payment of all Expenses out of Proceeds (or from Agent's own accounts if and to the extent there are insufficient Proceeds). All Expenses incurred during each week of the GOB Sale (i.e. Sunday through Saturday) shall be paid by Agent to or on behalf of Merchant, or paid by Merchant and thereafter reimbursed by Agent as provided for herein; provided, however, in the event that the actual amount of an Expense is unavailable on the date of the reconciliation (such as payroll), Merchant and Agent shall agree to an estimate of such amounts, which amounts will be reconciled once the actual amount of such Expense becomes available. Agent and/or Merchant may review or audit the Expenses at any time.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to and only upon entry of the Approval Order, Agent shall be responsible for the payment of all Expenses out of Proceeds (or from Agent's own accounts if and to the extent there are insufficient Proceeds). All Expenses incurred during each week of the GOB Sale (i.e. Sunday through Saturday) may be paid by Agent at their sole discretion. All Expenses incurred during the week may or may not be subject to reconciliation and may or may not be audited.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall be paid' to 'may be paid,' the obligation to pay expenses becomes discretionary. Removing the explicit instruction for reconciliation and auditing expenses creates ambiguity about financial responsibilities, directly conflicting with generally accepted accounting and business practices that emphasize proper accounting. The payment of the vendors and others may become uncertain.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Basic Contract Law (Offer, Acceptance, Consideration)
